Package ohos.location

Class Locator

  • java.lang.Object
    • ohos.location.Locator

  • public class Locator
extends Object
    Provides interfaces for initiating location requests, ending the location service, and obtaining the location result cached by the system.
    Since:
    1
    SystemCapability
    SystemCapability.Location#LOCATION

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      static int ERROR_PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED
      Indicates that the location permission has not been granted when the application calls the Locator interface.
      static int ERROR_SWITCH_UNOPEN
      Indicates that the location service has been disabled when the application calls the Locator interface.
      static int LOCATION_SERVICE_SWITCH_OFF
      Indicates that the location service is disabled.
      static int LOCATION_SERVICE_SWITCH_ON
      Indicates that the location service is enabled.
      static int SESSION_START
      Indicates that the location request has been accepted by the system.
      static int SESSION_STOP
      Indicates that the location request has finished.

    • Field Detail

      • ERROR_PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED

        public static final int ERROR_PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED
        Indicates that the location permission has not been granted when the application calls the Locator interface.

        The error is returned to the application through LocatorCallback.onErrorReport(int).

        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Constant Field Values

        The error is returned to the application through LocatorCallback.onErrorReport(int).

    • Method Detail

      • isLocationSwitchOn

        public boolean isLocationSwitchOn​()
        Checks whether the location service is enabled.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the location service is enabled; returns false otherwise.
        Since:
        1

      • requestEnableLocation

        public void requestEnableLocation​()
                           throws IllegalArgumentException
        Requests the user to enable the location service. When this method is called, the system will display a notification to the user.

        If the location service is already enabled, no operation is performed.

        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if Locator constructed without ability context.
        Since:
        3

      • startLocating

        public void startLocating​(RequestParam request,
                          LocatorCallback callback)
                   throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sends location requests to the system.

        The system starts the location service based on the input location request parameters and reports the location result to the application through the callback passed in this method.

        The system reports the location results to the application in real time until the application proactively stops the location service through stopLocating(ohos.location.LocatorCallback).

        To use this method, your application needs to apply for the ohos.permission.LOCATION permission from the user. If the location access permission has not been granted by the user when this method is called, the system returns ERROR_PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED to the application through LocatorCallback.

        If the location service is disabled when this method is called, the system returns error code ERROR_SWITCH_UNOPEN through LocatorCallback.

        Parameters:
        request - Indicates the location request parameters.
        callback - Indicates the callback for reporting the location result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified RequestParam object or the specified LocatorCallback object is null.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        RequestParam, LocatorCallback

      • stopLocating

        public void stopLocating​(LocatorCallback callback)
                  throws IllegalArgumentException
        Ends the location service.

        The specified callback object must be the same as that provided to the system when the location request is initiated.Otherwise, ending the location service will fail.

        Parameters:
        callback - Specifies the callback object for returning the location result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified LocatorCallback object is null.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        LocatorCallback

      • requestOnce

        public void requestOnce​(RequestParam request,
                        LocatorCallback callback)
                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Sends a single location request to the system.

        The system starts the location service based on the input location request parameters and reports the location result to the application through the callback passed in this method.

        This location request is automatically stopped after the system reports the location result. If the location cannot be completed within a reasonable amount of time due to environment issues, you can call stopLocating(ohos.location.LocatorCallback) to enable the application to proactively stop the location request.

        To use this method, your application needs to apply for the ohos.permission.LOCATION permission from the user. If the location access permission has not been granted by the user when this method is called, the system returns ERROR_PERMISSION_NOT_GRANTED to the application through LocatorCallback.

        If the location service is disabled when this method is called, the system returns error code ERROR_SWITCH_UNOPEN through LocatorCallback.

        Parameters:
        request - Indicates the location request parameters.
        callback - Indicates the callback for reporting the location result.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified RequestParam object or the specified LocatorCallback object is null.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        RequestParam, LocatorCallback

      • getCachedLocation

        public Location getCachedLocation​()
                           throws SecurityException
        Obtains the location information cached in the system.

        You can call this method to obtain the cached location information if you do not need the real-time location data.

        To use this method, you need to apply for the ohos.permission.LOCATION permission from the user.

        Returns:
        Returns the location information cached in the system; returns null if no location information has been cached.
        Throws:
        SecurityException - Throws this exception if your application is not granted the ohos.permission.LOCATION permission.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        Location

      • registerSwitchCallback

        public boolean registerSwitchCallback​(SwitchCallback callback)
                               throws IllegalArgumentException
        Registers a callback object for obtaining the location service status in real time.
        Parameters:
        callback - Specifies the callback object for obtaining the location service status. The value must not be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the registration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the specified SwitchCallback object is null.
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        SwitchCallback

      • unregisterSwitchCallback

        public boolean unregisterSwitchCallback​(SwitchCallback callback)
                                 throws IllegalArgumentException
        Deregisters the callback object used for obtaining the location service status.
        Parameters:
        callback - Specifies the callback object used for obtaining the location service status. The value must not be null.
        Returns:
        Returns true if the deregistration is successful; returns false otherwise.
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - Throws this exception if the value of callback is null.
        Since:
        3
        See Also:
        SwitchCallback
